title: Wife ‚Äòsurrenders‚Äô, 3 others arrested: How police cracked Meghalaya honeymoon murder case
content: In a shocking twist to the Meghalaya murder case, Sonam Raghuvanshi allegedly confessed to plotting her husband Raja's murder during their honeymoon in Shillong. Meghalaya DGP I Nongrang stated Sonam hired assailants to kill Raja. Sonam surrendered in Ghazipur, UP, while three others were arrested. The couple was last seen near living root bridges before Raja's body was discovered.

title: Honeymoon murder: Sonam came on foot, asked for mobile - what UP dhaba owner told cops
content: In a significant development, Sonam Raghuvanshi, the prime suspect in her husband Raja's murder during their Meghalaya honeymoon, has surrendered to Uttar Pradesh police. Located near Ghazipur, she's now under protective custody awaiting transfer to Meghalaya for interrogation. Police have arrested three alleged hitmen, who confessed to being hired by Sonam.

title: India's home season: BCCI revises schedule, swaps Delhi and Kolkata Test venues
content: The BCCI has revised venues for the 2025 home season, moving the India-South Africa Test from Delhi to Kolkata due to air quality concerns. Consequently, the India-West Indies Test shifts from Kolkata to Delhi. Outfield renovations in Chennai prompt a change in venue for the India Women vs Australia Women ODI series, with matches now in New Chandigarh and Delhi.

title: India‚Äôs 5th gen fighter: GE says ‚Äòvery interested‚Äô; speeds up Tejas Mark-1A engine delivery
content: General Electric (GE) is vying to supply engines for India's fifth-generation stealth fighter project, viewing India as a crucial strategic market. GE also aims to accelerate F-404 engine deliveries to HAL for the Tejas Mark-1A fighter program, addressing previous delays.

title: Steve Jobs tip to Apple CEO Tim Cook: Never to stay 'married' to my past ...; a skill Cook says he learnt late
content: Tim Cook credits Steve Jobs with teaching him the invaluable skill of rapidly changing his mind when presented with new evidence, a trait powered by emotional intelligence. Jobs's ability to shift direction and let go of pride influenced Cook and many others, including Jeff Bezos, Jony Ive, and Marc Benioff.

title: Mumbai railway tragedy: 5 dead, several injured after falling from moving local train
content: A tragic incident occurred between Diva and Mumbra stations, resulting in the death of five passengers and injuries to several others who fell from an overcrowded local train. The accident happened when two trains crossed paths, causing passengers on the footboards to collide and lose their balance.

title: Honeymoon murder case: 'Wife hired killers', say cops; 'Sonam innocent,' claims family
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi's father claims her innocence after she was arrested for allegedly hiring people to kill her husband during their honeymoon in Meghalaya. He accuses the Meghalaya Police of fabricating the story and plans to request a CBI inquiry.

title: Amazon has locked down hiring for this business; internal memo said: Any hiring requires‚Ä¶.
content: Amazon's retail division is freezing its 2025 hiring budget, maintaining flat headcount operating expenses compared to 2024, according to an internal email. This shift to budget-based hiring, part of CEO Jassy's cost-cutting campaign, gives managers spending limits and flexibility to hire contractors. Despite the freeze, Amazon emphasizes that hiring continues based on individual business needs.

title: IND vs ENG: What Team India will do in England today; series begins June 20
content: Team India gears up for the crucial Test series against England with an important training session in Beckenham. Led by Shubman Gill and coached by Gautam Gambhir, the squad is acclimatising to English conditions before a scheduled rest day. The team's preparation includes warm-up drills and sprint sessions, setting the stage for the first Test at Headingley.

title: WTC Final: How Bumrah's message eased Green's doubts; terms it 'special'
content: Ahead of his back surgery, Cameron Green received reassuring words from Jasprit Bumrah, who had undergone a similar procedure. Bumrah's comeback and performance inspired Green, boosting his confidence. Green, now recovered, is set to play in the WTC Final as a specialist batter, potentially batting at No. 3 for Australia.

title: Watch: One of the most bizarre run-outs ever ‚Äì keeper hits both ends with one throw
content: In an MPL 2025 match, Raigad Royals' Harsh Mogaveera suffered a freak run-out against Puneri Bappa. After the wicket-keeper's throw hit the stumps at the striker's end, the ball ricocheted to the non-striker's end, dislodging the bails and finding Mogaveera short of his ground. This bizarre dismissal has quickly gone viral, stunning players and fans alike.

title: Tesla Optimus chief resigns: Thanks Elon Musk in his farewell post on Twitter; says ‚ÄòYou have ‚Ä¶'
content: Milan Kovac, Tesla's Optimus robot project head, has resigned to spend more time with family abroad after nine years with the company. This transition occurs as Tesla intensifies its focus on autonomous technology and robotics. Ashok Elluswamy, currently leading Tesla‚Äôs Autopilot team, will assume Kovac‚Äôs responsibilities amidst challenges like rare-earth magnet export restrictions.

title: Drama in TNPL! Ashwin loses cool after dismissal; argues with female umpire - Watch
content: Ravichandran Ashwin found himself embroiled in controversy during a TNPL 2025 match after being dismissed LBW. Disagreeing with the umpire's decision, Ashwin engaged in a heated argument, which was captured on video and went viral. Replays suggested the ball might have pitched outside leg, adding fuel to the debate as Dindigul Dragons suffered a batting collapse and a heavy defeat.

title: Gold price prediction for June 9 - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices have fluctuated amid global uncertainty, reaching near four-week highs, while silver surpassed ‚Çπ1 lakh. Escalating geopolitical tensions and US-China trade discussions influence investor sentiment. Weaker US economic data raises stagflation concerns, but a resilient labor market keeps sentiment mixed.

title: Watch: Inside look at Rinku Singh and Priya Saroj‚Äôs engagement; couple's dance goes viral
content: Indian cricketer Rinku Singh and Samajwadi Party MP Priya Saroj celebrated their engagement in a lavish ceremony in Lucknow, attended by prominent political figures like Akhilesh Yadav and Jaya Bachchan. The couple's union blends the worlds of sports and politics, marking a significant moment as they embark on their journey together.

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder mystery: Missing wife found near UP dhaba; three hitmen arrested
content: In a shocking turn of events, Indore resident Raja Raghuvanshi was murdered during his honeymoon in Meghalaya, orchestrated by his wife, Sonam. Meghalaya DGP I Nongrang confirmed Sonam's surrender in Uttar Pradesh, along with the arrest of three assailants from Madhya Pradesh.

title: BSF unveils new uniforms; smart tech deployed on Pakistan, Bangladesh fronts
content: BSF soldiers guarding the Bangladesh and Pakistan borders will soon sport new combat uniforms made of a more comfortable and flexible fabric blend. The updated uniform, featuring a digital pattern, is designed for improved breathability and stretch. Simultaneously, the Rajasthan border is being reinforced with smart fencing and advanced surveillance technology, including upgraded CCTVs and intrusion detection systems.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 crosses 25,100; BSE Sensex up over 400 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday. While Nifty50 went above 25,100, BSE Sensex was up over 400 points.

title: French Open: Alcaraz channels his three C's to top Sinner; wins fifth major title
content: Carlos Alcaraz triumphed over Jannik Sinner in the longest French Open final in history, winning 4-6, 6-7, 6-4, 7-6, 7-6 after five hours and 29 minutes. Down two sets and three championship points, Alcaraz staged a stunning comeback, capturing his fifth Grand Slam title at just 22. This first major final in their rivalry delivered a generational classic.

title: IAS officer held for taking Rs 10L bribe; Rs 47L seized from house during raid
content: In Odisha, vigilance officials apprehended IAS officer Dhiman Chakma, the sub-collector of Dharamgarh, for allegedly accepting a ‚Çπ10 lakh bribe from a businessman in Kalahandi. Authorities caught Chakma red-handed at his government residence following a complaint. Subsequent searches uncovered an additional ‚Çπ47 lakh in unaccounted cash at his official residence.

title: Vijay Mallya performed Sameera Reddy‚Äôs ‚ÄòKanyadaan‚Äô; here‚Äôs how they‚Äôre related
content: Amidst Vijay Mallya's controversies, a surprising detail resurfaced: he performed the kanyadaan at Sameera Reddy's intimate 2014 wedding. The actress revealed Mallya's role, highlighting the close-knit ceremony with family and friends. Now, celebrating 11 years of marriage with Akshai Varde, Sameera has shifted her focus to body positivity and parenting content, engaging with fans online.

title: Watch: Unreal moment in cricket! Batter on 98 bowled, but bails don't fall
content: A Big Cricket League match in Surat witnessed a bizarre incident when batter Chirag Gandhi, on 98, hit his stumps, but the bail miraculously remained in place. Despite the lucky break, UP Brij Stars failed to chase MP Tigers' 239-run target. Gandhi remained unbeaten on 101, but his team fell short, highlighting cricket's unpredictable nature.

title: B'luru stampede: Siddaramaiah blames police; denies govt role
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah distanced his government from the stampede deaths following an RCB victory celebration, blaming mismanagement by the police, KSCA, and RCB. He stated he was only informed of the incident nearly two hours after it occurred and had only approved the Vidhana Soudha event.

title: LA protests turn violent; Trump sends Guard troops: What triggered the outrage?
content: Tensions are high in Los Angeles following immigration raids and President Trump's deployment of National Guard troops, sparking widespread protests. Demonstrators clashed with police, torched vehicles, and blocked freeways, leading to the deployment of California's 79th Infantry Brigade. Governor Newsom condemned Trump's actions as a breach of state sovereignty, while Democrats criticized the troop deployment as an escalation.

title: Elon Musk‚Äôs 'behavior' linked to hypomania, says Dr Drew; here‚Äôs what it is
content: Doctor Drew suggests Elon Musk may have hypomania. Hypomania includes elevated mood and hyperactivity. It differs from mania. Genetics, imbalance of chemicals, stress, and less sleep can cause it. Symptoms include less sleep, rapid speech, and risk-taking. Hypomania can cause burnout and strained relations. Diagnosis involves psychiatric evaluation. Treatment includes medication, therapy, and lifestyle changes.

title: ‚ÄòWhole world now knows the truth‚Äô: Tharoor-led delegation wraps up US visit
content: A multi-party Indian delegation, led by Shashi Tharoor, concluded a US visit aimed at garnering international support for India's counter-terrorism efforts after the Pahalgam attack. The delegation met with US leaders, including Vice President JD Vance, who expressed support for India's response.

title: Economic terrorism as serious as cross-border terrorism: Naidu
content: Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu describes his first year back in office as challenging, citing economic setbacks and distrust from international partners due to the previous administration. Despite these hurdles, he aims for a 15% growth rate by leveraging technology and developing Amaravati into a Quantum Valley.

title: Top stocks to buy or sell: Stock recommendations for the week starting June 9
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal Financial Services recommends PNB Housing Finance and Prestige Estate as top stock picks for the week starting June 9, 2025. PNB Housing Finance reported a strong fourth quarter, anticipating further growth driven by easing interest rates. Prestige Estate experienced a significant rise in pre-sales.

title: French Open Final: Alcaraz saves 3 match points, outlasts Sinner to defend Roland-Garros crown
content: Carlos Alcaraz showcased remarkable resilience at the 2025 French Open, retaining his title against Jannik Sinner in a gruelling five-set final. Alcaraz overcame a two-set deficit and saved multiple match points to secure his fifth Grand Slam title. The epic battle, marked by exceptional skill and drama, will be remembered as a classic.

title: ‚Äã'Thug Life' box office collection: Mani Ratnam's film inches closer to Rs 40cr mark
content: Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life,' starring Kamal Haasan, is making waves at the box office, earning ‚Çπ36.90 crore in its first four days. Despite controversy over Haasan's remarks about the Kannada language, which led to the film's ban in Karnataka, 'Thug Life' boasts a strong cast and gripping narrative.

title: Delhi sizzles again: Mercury hits 42.1¬∞C; heatwave alert out as temps may touch 45¬∞C
content: Delhi's temperature soared to 42.1¬∞C on Sunday, crossing 40¬∞C after 17 days, prompting a 'yellow' heatwave alert for Monday and Tuesday with potential highs of 45¬∞C. Similar scorching conditions are sweeping Haryana, Punjab, and Rajasthan, with temperatures exceeding 45¬∞C in several areas. Relief is expected from June 13 with predicted rain and thunderstorms.

title: Four public sector banks cut lending rates after RBI move
content: Following the RBI's repo rate cut, public and private sector banks are adjusting lending rates. Existing borrowers with floating-rate loans are poised to benefit more due to automatic rate reductions. Banks are tweaking spreads on home loans and may lower fixed deposit returns to protect profitability, potentially impacting new borrowers and savers.

title: ‚ÄòHousefull 5‚Äô box office collection: Akshay Kumar starrer inches towards Rs 90cr mark
content: Housefull 5 is performing well at the box office. The movie earned Rs 87 crore in its first three days. Sunday showed a strong turnout in cinemas. Akshay Kumar visited a cinema hall in disguise to get fan reactions. Directed by Tarun Mansukhani, the film features a whodunnit angle. Shreyas Talpade returns to the franchise after a decade.

title: If strictly veg, why order from eatery that also serves non-veg: Consumer panel
content: A consumer commission dismissed a complaint by two Dadar residents who sought compensation after being served chicken momos at Wow Momos, despite claiming they ordered vegetarian. The commission questioned their choice of a restaurant with non-vegetarian options and noted the invoice indicated a non-vegetarian order. Furthermore, the residents failed to provide sufficient evidence to support their claims of religious disruption.

title: Falling fast: Shedeur Sanders picked behind Gabriel; Browns depth chart raises eyebrows
content: Shedeur Sanders faces challenges with the Cleveland Browns. Once a top prospect, he is now fourth-string quarterback. Critics question his commitment due to his off-field activities. Despite impressive college stats, he needs to prove himself. Joe Flacco is the current frontrunner. Sanders must show performance and patience to succeed. His journey from college star to NFL underdog is surprising.

title: Formally write to us on Maharashtra 'rigging', EC babus dare Rahul Gandhi
content: Election Commission officials are challenging Rahul Gandhi to formalize his claims of "rigging" in the 2024 Maharashtra assembly elections by writing to the poll panel. The EC insists it can only offer a formal rebuttal to his "baseless allegations" if he communicates his grievances directly. The commission also expressed disappointment that Gandhi hasn't responded despite being invited for consultations.

title: From classroom to cosmos: Shubhanshu Shukla‚Äôs wife looks back & ahead
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's upcoming space mission aboard Axiom-4 marks a significant milestone for India. His wife, Kamna, shares her perspective on this journey, highlighting Shukla's dedication and courage. She fondly recalls his transition from a fighter pilot to a space explorer, emphasizing his problem-solving skills and unwavering spirit.

title: B'luru stampede: Families blame govt; ask who approved event; say cash won't heal loss
content: Families of the victims of the stampede outside Chinnaswamy Stadium are demanding answers regarding who authorized the victory celebrations that led to the tragedy. They question the need for the event, citing adequate celebrations the previous night, and criticize the lack of safety measures despite awareness of potential crowds.

title: Small towns boom: Tier-2 cities lead hiring surge; metros fall behind in talent race
content: Hiring in India's smaller cities is booming, outpacing metros with a 42% surge compared to 19%, reveals the Randstad Talent Insights Report 2025. BFSI, manufacturing, retail, and IT sectors are fueling this growth, establishing tier-2 cities as emerging talent hubs. Bengaluru leads tier-1 demand, while Chandigarh shines among tier-2 cities.

title: Manipur unrest: Curfew after Meitei leader's arrest; protests flare, internet shut down
content: Manipur is facing renewed unrest following the arrest of Arambai Tenggol leader, Kanan Singh, sparking violent protests in five valley districts. Authorities have imposed curfews, prohibitory orders, and suspended internet services to control the escalating tensions.

title: Packers-&-movers smuggle ganja worth Rs 27L with bank manager‚Äôs goods; 3 arrested
content: A packers-and-movers transporter, Avinash Dhoke, was arrested for concealing 108kg of marijuana within the household goods of a bank manager being transferred from Odisha to Nagpur. Kalamna police intercepted the consignment and arrested Dhoke and his associate, Palash Wankhede.

title: No need of slum-dwellers‚Äô nod for Dharavi project, says CEO
content: Dharavi's redevelopment proceeds with over 50% resident consent, though not legally required due to government appointment of Nav Bharat Mega Developers, led by the Adani Group. A survey indicates 5 lakh eligible for free housing within Dharavi, while 5 lakh ineligible will be relocated to subsidized rental housing. Concerns arise over land allocation for rental units and free sale components.

title: After 13-year career, burglar‚Äôs home has gym, chandelier, bath tub
content: Amit Dutta, a 46-year-old man leading a double life, was apprehended by Howrah police for attempted burglary. For 13 years, he posed as a helpful neighbor by day and a thief by night. His lavish lifestyle, funded by stolen cash and jewelry, included a mansion with modern amenities and even a trip to Indonesia.

title: Wife's Affair Led To Meghalaya Honeymoon Murder, Boyfriend Involved: Cops
content: As the mystery deepens over the murder of an Indore man during his honeymoon in Meghalaya's hills, police now claim that the victim's wife had an extramarital affair angle that allegedly drove her to hire contract killers to eliminate her husband.

title: Trump's Travel Ban Comes Into Effect. List Of 12 Affected Countries
content: The new travel ban ordered by US President Donald Trump is set to come into effect from Monday. The ban restricts citizens of 12 countries -- mostly from Africa and the Middle East -- from entering the United States.

title: Who Is Amir Tataloo, Iran's Tattooed Rap Star Now Facing Death Sentence
content: Iran's Supreme Court has sentenced renowned pop singer Amir Hossein Maghsoudloo, popularly known as Tataloo, to death after he was convicted of blasphemy, including insulting the Prophet Mohammed.

title: In Pics: Burning Cars, Tear Gas At Los Angeles Anti-Immigration Protests
content: Demonstrators clashed with the US National Guard and police in Los Angeles on Sunday, where tear gas and pepper spray were fired at the crowd protesting against the anti-immigration raids by authorities, which began Friday afternoon.

title: US National Guard Deployed In Los Angeles: What Threats Do They Counter
content: The US National Guard is a part-time military force that serves both state and federal governments. Each state has its own Guard units.

title: Meghalaya Honeymoon Murder: Stunning Late Night Call And The Big Twist
content: The Raghuvanshis from Indore were on honeymoon in Meghalaya when they disappeared. An intense search operation followed in the state's lush peaks and serene mountains.

title: Honeymoon Murder Live Updates: Wife Surrenders After Husband's Murder, Indore Couple Had Gone Missing in Meghalaya
content: Sonam had reportedly gone missing after her husband's body was discovered in a gorge beneath the Weisawdong Falls parking lot in East Khasi Hills on June 2.

title: Lucknow To Low Earth Orbit: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla Heads to Space Lab
content: India is all set to send its second astronaut into space, nearly four decades after Wing Commander Rakesh Sharma made history in 1984. This time, the mission is not with Russia but in collaboration with the US, under the Indo-US Axiom-4 mission.

title: "Golden Era Of Public Service": Amit Shah On 11 Years Of PM Modi-Led Government
content: Narendra Modi first took oath as the Prime Minister of India on May 26, 2014, and is currently serving his third consecutive term.

title: Honeymoon Murder: Wife "Surrendered Under Pressure", Cops To Bring Her Back To Meghalaya
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, the woman who is suspected to be involved in the murder of her husband, Indore-based Raja Raghuvanshi, during their honeymoon in Meghalaya, "surrendered under pressure," the police said.

title: "Sonam Being Alive Raises Questions": Murdered Indore Man's Family
content: The newlywed couple had visited Meghalaya's Cherrapunjee in the East Khasi Hills for their honeymoon when they went missing on May 23.

title: India Marked Rapid Growth Across Diverse Sectors In 11 Years: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi asserted on Monday that under the 11 years of his government India has not just become the fastest-growing major economy but is also a key global voice on pressing issues like climate action and digital innovation.

title: Opinion: Opinion | How China Has Been Blocking India's UNSC Actions Since The 2000s
content: China's pattern of using "technical holds" in the UNSC 1267 Sanctions Committee can be traced to the early 2000s.

title: Why Los Angeles Is Boiling: Immigration Raids, Fiery Protests, Guards On Streets
content: The streets of Los Angeles were brimming with protesters over the weekend after federal immigration raids led to dozens of arrests.

title: Nepal's First Breast Milk Bank Helps Newborn Babies Survive
content: Nepal's first-ever Human Milk Bank, 'Amrit Kosh,' is a step towards providing baby-friendly health care to low birthweight, premature, and other at-risk newborns. It helps infants with access to breastmilk at the most critical times.

title: World's Largest Container Ship MSC IRINA Arrives At Vizhinjam Seaport
content: The world's largest container ship, MSC IRINA, on Monday arrived at the Vizhinjam International Seaport in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. The berthing process for the vessel has begun at the port.

title: "Arrest People In Masks": Trump's New Mandate As Los Angeles Burns
content: US President Donald Trump has ordered law enforcement authorities to arrest the protestors wearing masks as tensions in Los Angeles escalated on Sunday amid mass demonstrations over the immigration crackdown.

title: Thaw In Musk-Trump Tensions? Billionaire Shares Trump Post On LA Riots
content: Billionaire Elon Musk has reshared US President Donald Trump's Truth Social post blaming California leaders for the ongoing LA riots.

title: Researchers Develop Innovative Model To Study Sense Of Smell: Study
content: Using three-dimensional model, researchers at Tufts University School of Medicine and the Graduate School of Biomedical Sciences (GSBS) have discovered that key stem cells in the nose that regenerate small neurons, helps in treating loss of smell.

title: To succeed at Western Kentucky, Tyson Helton seeks gunslingers
content: western Kentucky head coach Tyson Helton evaluates a quarterback . he says he wants a player completely unaffected by the moment . "there's not one damn great quarterback who don't walk up there like John Wayne," helton says .

content: our fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the week's finale features the Boston Red Sox visiting the new york Yankees in the ESPN Sunday night showcase . title: The Big Two? This Alcaraz-Sinner rivalry is epic
content: Carlos Alcaraz beats Jannik Sinner 4-6, 6-7 (4), 6-4, 7-6 (3) . it was the second-longest major final in the era, the longest at Roland garros . the two men had won the french open for 20 years .

title: With French Open title, Coco Gauff's time is now
content: coco Gauff wins first major win of the year at the french open . she outlasts Sabalenka to win 1st french open 15h Simon Cambers . a year removed from her junior title and just months after winning a wta tour tour .

title: Denny Hamlin, awaiting son's birth, wins at Michigan
content: Denny Hamlin outlasted the competition at Michigan International Speedway for his third victory of the season . the 44-year-old was prepared to leave his team to join his fianc√©e, Jordan Fish, who is due to give birth to their third child, a boy .

title: How the spoils will get divided from NCAA settlement
content: university of Alabama athletic director Greg Byrne has worked in college athletics for over three decades . he's seen it all, at least until late Friday night, when he began officially facing a new challenge . the settlement allows athletic departments to pay out about $20.5 million directly to their players .
